title: Caught in the act! Australian couple arrested after they 'had sex on a bench in Florence' (prompting politician to plea for better quality tourists)

A pair of tourists have been arrested after allegedly having sex on a bench near Florence’s world famous Ponte Vecchio.
In just the latest example of tourists behaving badly in the Renaissance capital, the couple were allegedly caught in the act in the Lungarno Torrigiani public gardens around 11.45 pm on Monday night.
Passing Florentines and visitors were shocked by the sight but the couple were allegedly unfazed by the attention.
A pair of tourists have been arrested after allegedly having sex on a bench near Florence’s world famous Ponte Vecchio
Passersby eventually resorted to calling the police who arrived in time to catch them en flagrante, it is alleged.
A 23-year-old man and 20-year-old woman, both Australian, have been charged with committing an obscene act in a public place.
The scandalous episode came as the Italian minister for Culture Dario Franceschini said that Italy wanted to upgrade the calibre of its visitors and focus on ‘elite’ tourists.

Earlier this week the mayor of Barcelona slighted Italy’s tourism industry when she said that the Spanish city ‘dies not want to become like Venice’ which has declined under the pressure from mass tourism.
In recent years Florence has been plagued by incidents with badly behaved tourists.
In January a Japanese tourist was caught writing her name on the Ponte Vecchio, while in 2013 a German tourist was ordered to clean the famous bridge and fined €160 after his daughter drew on it with a felt-tip pen.

Last September an American couple were photographed having sex on the doorstop of a Chanel boutique.
A few months before an American girl was caught urinating between two cars at a taxi rank in the heart of the city.
In 2012 City councillor Mario Razzanelli said that Piazza Santa Croce had become 'an open-air brothel' after an American couple was caught having sex under the statue of mediaeval poet Dante Alighieri.

Locals are so disgusted by the behaviour of visitors to the city that they have set up a Facebook group known as Firenze Degrado to shame those who bring the city into disrepute.
Elsewhere in Italy two women and a Frenchman were caught last year having an orgy in the ancient ruins of what was Pompeii’s red light district.
Two American tourists are set to stand trial in Rome this year after getting caught carving their initials into the wall of the Colosseum.
